text: Suanarunsawat et al . ( 2010 ) [ 58 ] have investigated the anti - hyperlipidemic and antioxidant activities of essential oils extracted from Ocimum sanctum L . leaves in rats fed with high cholesterol diet . Eugenol and methyl eugenol were the most important components in the essential oils . The oils were able to decrease the high levels of TBARS either in cardiac or liver tissues , protecting them against stress induced oxidation .
